DOC.brief_title: Comparison Dexmedetomidine Fentanyl Prevent Hemodynamic Response Skull Pins Application
DOC.detailed_description: A randomized , double-blinded control trial conduct September 2015 September 2016 Srinagarind Hospital , Faculty Medicine , Khon Kaen University , Thailand . Sixty patient underwent craniotomy insertion skull pin randomly allocate group A B . After patient enter operative room , blood pressure heart rate measure ( T1 ) repeat measurement ( T2 ) start induction , intubation infusion dexmedetomidine 1 µg/kg 10 min infusion group A whereas group B receive normal saline . At 3 minute skull pin insertion ( T3 ) , patient group B receive single bolus fentanyl 1 µg/kg whereas group A receive normal saline . Then hemodynamic response record repeat one minute skull pin insertion ( T4 ) . Blood pressure heart rate observe time skull pin insertion ( T5 ) repeat every 1 minute skull pin application 5 minute ( T6 - T10 ) .
DOC.criteria: patient schedule elective craniotomy general anesthesia patient American Society Anesthesiologists physical status classification I II patient body mass index 30 kg/m2 , heart rate lower 45 bpm , hypertension , ischemic heart disease , heart block , beta adrenergic blocker , medication allergy include propofol , fentanyl , dexmedetomidine .
